errors.error_description: Reference to a non-existent requirements.txt file in the project root directory
correction_candidates: Remove the instruction to install from requirements.txt as the file doesn't exist
Change the file path to point to an existing requirements file in the correct location
Create a note that requirements.txt should be created by the user first
Replace with instruction to install dependencies using setup.py instead
errors.golden_answer: Remove the instruction to install from requirements.txt as the file doesn't exist

errors.error_description: Reference to development dependencies in setup.py using incorrect installation syntax
correction_candidates: Change the command to python -m pip install -e .[dev] for proper editable installation
Use pip install -e . to install in development mode without extra dependencies
Replace with pip install -r dev-requirements.txt for development dependencies
Use python setup.py develop to install in development mode
errors.golden_answer: Change the command to python -m pip install -e .[dev] for proper editable installation
